The rule of law is a fundamental tenet of American democracy. Its enforcement requires elected leaders to set aside partisanship for principle. 

We must reaffirm our commitment to the rule of law by upholding our constitutional checks and balances.
As the Senate begins an impeachment trial, it is critical that each of us fully assesses the evidence and any witnesses presented.

Congress has few responsibilities more important than defending our constitutional order. 

Today, the House fulfilled that responsibility.

This is a solemn day for America. 

There is clear evidence that President Trump abused his office and obstructed Congress. 

This has left the House of Representatives no choice but to pursue an impeachment inquiry and vote to impeach the President.
